output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in Digital Signal Processing, equipping you with the knowledge and skills to analyze, design, and implement DSP systems in various applications.
output.introduction: Welcome to Digital Signal Processing! This course will delve into the fundamental concepts and techniques used to process signals in the digital domain. We will explore topics such as signal representation, discrete-time systems, frequency analysis, filter design, and practical applications of DSP.

chapters.description: Overview of continuous-time and discrete-time signals. Basic signal operations (scaling, shifting, time reversal). Introduction to systems and their properties (linearity, time-invariance, causality, stability).
Representation of discrete-time signals. Common discrete-time signals (unit impulse, unit step, exponential). Signal energy and power.
Representation of discrete-time systems. Linear Time-Invariant (LTI) systems. Convolution sum.
Definition of the Z-transform. Region of convergence (ROC). Properties of the Z-transform.
Methods for finding the inverse Z-transform (partial fraction expansion, power series expansion).
System function. Stability analysis using the Z-transform. Frequency response from the Z-transform.
Definition of the DFT. Properties of the DFT. Circular convolution.
Radix-2 FFT algorithms (Decimation-in-Time, Decimation-in-Frequency). Computational complexity of the FFT.
Spectral analysis using the DFT. Filtering using the DFT.

modules.moduleTitle: Frequency Analysis: The Discrete Fourier Transform

chapters.description: Introduction to FIR filters. Linear phase FIR filters. Windowing method for FIR filter design.
Introduction to IIR filters. Impulse invariance method. Bilinear transformation method.
Direct form, cascade form, and parallel form filter structures.
Decimation and interpolation. Polyphase filter structures for sampling rate conversion.
Audio processing (equalization, noise reduction). Image processing (filtering, edge detection).
Introduction to DSP processors. Overview of DSP software tools (MATLAB, Python).
